snippet.title: Woman hit by bus in Brisbane's north 'bleeding seriously from neck'
snippet.content: A woman was "bleeding seriously" from the neck after she was hit by a bus in Brisbane's north early on Tuesday. A witness to the accident, outside Taigum Shopping Centre about 6.10am on Tuesday, told police the woman was bleeding seriously from the neck.Photo: File photo/Harrison Saragossi Paramedics rushed to the Beams Road address and took the woman, thought to be in her 20s, to the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital in a stable condition. A Queensland Ambulance Service spokeswoman said the woman had a cut to the neck. Both the 325 and 335 buses were skipping the stop following the crash, according to Translink.
